title: Georgi Tigiyev
text:
Georgi Lvovich Tigiyev (; born 26 May 1995) is a Russian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er who plays as a <a href="left-back">left-back</a>.
Club career.
Tigiyev made his professional debut on 3 May 2015 for <a href="FC%20Torpedo%20Moscow">FC Torpedo Moscow</a> in a <a href="Russian%20Football%20Premier%20League">Russian Football Premier League</a> game against <a href="FC%20Rubin%20Kazan">FC Rubin Kazan</a>. In July 2015, he signed for <a href="FC%20Anzhi%20Makhachkala">FC Anzhi Makhachkala</a>. He made his league debut for the club on 1 August 2015 in a 1-0 away loss to <a href="PFC%20CSKA%20Moscow">CSKA Moscow</a>. He was subbed on for <a href="Georgi%20Zotov">Georgi Zotov</a> at halftime. On 24 February 2017, he signed a loan contract with <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">FC Spartak Moscow</a> that ran until 31 May 2017. He made his league debut for the club on 3 April 2017 in a 3–2 home victory over <a href="FC%20Orenburg">FC Orenburg</a>. He was subbed off in the 56th minute, being replaced by <a href="Andrey%20Yeshchenko">Andrey Yeshchenko</a>. On 13 June 2017, he signed a full long-term contract with Spartak.
On 31 August 2018, he joined <a href="PFC%20Krylia%20Sovetov%20Samara">PFC Krylia Sovetov Samara</a> on loan for the 2018–19 season. On 28 February 2019, Krylia Sovetov announced he would move on another loan to Belarus at <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Minsk">Dinamo Minsk</a> until the summer.
